div.bibl: Onze Toekomst, Feb. 13, 1920. [CALVIN COLLEGE GETS A PLEASANT SURPRISE]

body.p: A few weeks ago Calvin College had a pleasant surprise; it received two gifts, each of $10,000. This proves conclusively the interest in higher Christian education, and this interest is certainly not misplaced. The establishment of schools for lower, middle, and higher education for us Reformed people in America has a fundamental meaning. Chicago's new Christian high school, too, will cost thousands of dollars if it is to attain its aim. How good it would feel if we received a few gifts, also.
We know that Chicago's high school has a number of staunch supporters who will see to it that the school is built, and by September.
